greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = prime(p-1)^e.
comment: a(n) = A064554(n) for 1 <= n < 91, but a(91) = 481 differs from A064554(91) = 463. - _Georg Fischer_, Oct 23 2018
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
formula: A046523(a(n)) = A046523(n). [Preserves the prime signature of n].
mathematica: Array[If[# == 1, 1, Times @@ Map[Prime[#1 - 1]^#2 & @@ # &, FactorInteger[#]]] &, 65] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 22 2021 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {my(f = factor(n)); for (k=1, #f~, f[k, 1] = prime(f[k, 1]-1);); factorback(f);}
return 1 if n==1 else reduce(mul, [prime(p - 1)**e for p, e in factorint(n).items()])
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Aug 08 2017
results.author: _Michel Marcus_, Aug 08 2017
